head.supplied: Melbourne bot Museum ¶ 8/7/73, ¶ ¶ In working on some of your Glumaceae, dear Dr Story, for the 7th & 8th volume of the Australian Flora, I came across the enclosed fibre from a grass, with which you...

div.p: DX19 Cotton/Story papers, Archives, University of Tasmania, Hobart.

In working on some of your Glumaceae, dear Dr Story, for the 7th & 8th volume of the Australian Flora, I came across the enclosed fibre from a grass, with which you tied some plants in your collection. I should like to have a sample of this fibre for paper material and the Grass (perhaps a Stipa or Dichelachne) which yields it for naming. In all likelihood a new export might arise to Tasmania, if this fibre could be brought fully into notice of merchants and Manufacturers
